perturbation.original_text: Payments of Royalties and Service Fees will be due on a calendar quarterly basis, within [***] days after the end of the calendar quarter in which the applicable Licensed Products were Sold or services were rendered. From the date a payment is due, unless otherwise agreed, any late payment will accrue a late payment fee of [***] per month, or the highest interest rate permitted by law, whichever is less.
perturbation.changed_text: Payments of Royalties and Service Fees will be due on a calendar quarterly basis, within [***] days after the end of the calendar quarter in which the applicable Licensed Products were Sold or services were rendered. From the date a payment is due, unless otherwise agreed, any late payment will accrue a late payment fee of [***] per month for the first 30 days, after which point the interest rate will increase to [***] per month, or the highest interest rate permitted by law, whichever is less.
perturbation.explanation: The changed text introduces an inconsistency in the late payment fee structure. Initially, the late payment fee is set at [***] per month. However, after 30 days, the fee increases to [***] per month. This creates ambiguity regarding the applicable late payment fee and could lead to disputes over the correct amount due.

perturbation.original_text: Each party will maintain, during the Term and for three (3) years thereafter, such comprehensive general liability insurance (including without limitation, products liability) as will adequately protect it against its potential liabilities under this Agreement, in amounts customary in the semiconductor industry for similar services and products.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will maintain, during the Term and for three (3) years thereafter, such comprehensive general liability insurance (including without limitation, products liability) as will adequately protect it against its potential liabilities under this Agreement, in amounts customary in the semiconductor industry for similar services and products. However, ENERGOUS' insurance coverage must extend to five (5) years after the Term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a consistent insurance requirement for both parties for three years post-term. The modification adds a contradictory requirement that ENERGOUS must maintain insurance for five years post-term. This creates uncertainty about the insurance obligations and may lead to disputes about the required coverage.

perturbation.original_text: Upon any termination or expiration of this Agreement, all rights, licenses (including any sublicenses granted by DIALOG) and obligations hereunder will cease, except that the provisions of Sections 6 (Intellectual Property Ownership), 9 (Royalties and Service Fees), 10 (Confidentiality), 11 (Representations and Warranties; Disclaimers), 12 (Indemnification), 13 (Limitation of Liability), 15.3 (Effect of Termination), 15.4 (Wind Down Period), 16 (Escrow), 18 (Non-Solicitation), 19 (Choice of Law and Dispute Resolution) and any provisions to give effect thereto, will survive such termination or expiration and remain in full force and effect in accordance with their terms.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon any termination or expiration of this Agreement, all rights, licenses (including any sublicenses granted by DIALOG) and obligations hereunder will cease, except that the provisions of Sections 6 (Intellectual Property Ownership), 9 (Royalties and Service Fees), 10 (Confidentiality), 11 (Representations and Warranties; Disclaimers), 12 (Indemnification), 13 (Limitation of Liability), 15.3 (Effect of Termination), 15.4 (Wind Down Period), 16 (Escrow), 18 (Non-Solicitation), 19 (Choice of Law and Dispute Resolution) and any provisions to give effect thereto, will survive such termination or expiration and remain in full force and effect in accordance with their terms. However, Section 9 (Royalties and Service Fees) will only survive for one year after termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Section 9 (Royalties and Service Fees) survives termination. The changed text adds a contradictory statement that Section 9 will only survive for one year after termination. This creates ambiguity about the duration of the royalty and service fee obligations post-termination.
